image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives
image.name: W000235_001

profileText: A Representative from Ohio; born in Toledo, Lucas County, Ohio, July 26, 1931; attended the public schools; A.B., Denison University, Granville, Ohio, 1953; LL.B., Harvard Law School, 1956; served in the United States Army, 1956-1958; admitted to the Ohio bar in 1956 and commenced practice in Toledo, 1958; assistant professor, Toledo University School of Law, 1966-1979; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-seventh Congress (January 3, 1981-January 3, 1983); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1982; resumed the practice of law; died on February 27, 2023, in Perrysburg Township, Ohio.

asset.name: W000235_001
asset.creditLine: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

researchRecord.name: 1980-1983, 14.5 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Edward F. Weber contain correspondence, subject files, some campaign materials, photographs, newspaper clippings, and press releases.

recordLocation.name: The Ward M. Canaday Center for Special Collections, Carlson Library
